para.text: Evaluate the above expression to create a
object from a .WAV file and then play it twice using the
message. Because the expression is laid out over three lines that all need to be evaluated at once, you should select them all before choosing Evaluate It (Ctrl+E).

One interesting point here is the use of the semicolon to "cascade" one message after another to the first object in the expression (in this case, the sound). Without the semicolon, the Smalltalk compiler would actually send the second
message to the result of the first one, rather than to the original sound object.
